executiveSummary: Entrepreneur Aaliyah Marendis from Austin, Texas pitched her company, Sugardoh, a natural at-home hair removal product, seeking $500,000 for 5% equity (a $10 million valuation). Despite strong sales growth from $50K in 2020 to $5.6M in 2022, the Sharks declined to invest due to high debt, lack of profitability, and valuation concerns.
nextSteps: Aaliyah plans to continue growing Sugardoh independently, improving margins, reducing debt, and expanding into more retailers despite not receiving an investment.
